title: Research, innovation, entrepreneurship are thrust areas for Higher Education 2.0, says top NITI Aayog official
content: Mr. Shah said that the contribution of innovation and entrepreneurship has been reflected in the steady rise of start-ups in the country.

title: Death toll in Karur stampede rises to 40; Justice Aruna Jagadeesan begins inquiries
content: Of the 40 dead, 17 were women, 14 men, and nine children. Medical teams completed post-mortems on all victims on September 27 night and began handing over the bodies to their families before dawn on September 28

title: Two civilians killed in Ladakh protests cremated amid curfew in Leh
content: The unrest in Ladakh is the BJP’s own creation. The same people who once cheered abrogation of Article 370  now feel betrayed by unkept promises. Youth anger, joblessness, and denial of Sixth Schedule rights have pushed them to the streets

title: Punjab should be seen as India’s gateway to Eurasia, says Congress’ Bajwa
content: The Opposition leader proposed the creation of an ‘Amritsar-Rajpura economic corridor’ with ‘agro-processing clusters, industrial parks, and logistics hubs powering Punjab’s integration into global supply chains’

title: In stampede cases, police must prove ‘gross’ criminal negligence directly endangered human life, according to court verdicts
content: One of the offences levelled against TVK leaders in a case registered by the Karur Town Police following a stampede at a meeting addressed by actor Vijay is commission of an “act endangering life and personal safety of others”

title: Incessant rain batters Maharashtra; over 11,500 people shifted to relief camps
content: Six villages in Dharashiv cut off; CM Fadnavis terms next two days “critical” as IMD issues red alert for Mumbai, Konkan, and Marathwada

title: LDF backs NSS leadership that is under fire for endorsing government’s Sabarimala policy
content: Transport Minister K.B. Ganesh Kumar slams “scattered protests by a few disgruntled elements” and says Sukumaran Nair has not veered from NSS’s stated principle of political equi-distance

title: SFI slams Andhra Pradesh government’s move to hand over 10 medical colleges to private parties under PPP
content: The SFI leaders warn the move will make medical education unaffordable and healthcare costlier, and accuse State and Central governments of neglecting public education and student welfare

title: Article in Raj Bhavan’s magazine in sharp focus after Kerala CM’s remarks
content: Legal Adviser to the Governor deals with the Supreme Court judgment of April 8 with respect to the Tamil Nadu Governor reserving Bills for the President’s assent

title: Devotees chant ‘Govinda... Govinda’ as Lord Malayappa rides the imperial ‘Garuda Vahanam’
content: Hundreds of devotees stand reverently in their places and offer ‘harati’ in unison to the processional deity adorned in an array of priceless and antique ornaments

title: Clinic opens in Kondapur, to cater to IT Corridor’s healthcare needs
content: For people with busy schedules and for those requiring comprehensive health check-ups, this clinic will be very useful, says Union Minister Kishan Reddy

title: Pilgrim footfalls peak as more than two lakh descend on Tirumala for ‘Garuda Seva’
content: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams, the Police, the Vigilance and Security teams, and the district administration work in tandem to ensure a safe and comfortable experience for the teeming pilgrims

title: Queer-friendly clinic gets operational in Ernakulam General Hospital
content: Apart from the queer-friendly clinic, the hospital now has a modern mortuary complex, a stroke ICU, and a renovated cath lab

title: Vigilance raids uncover corruption in forest range offices
content: Operation Vanaraksha undertaken simultaneously in 71 forest range offices across Kerala uncovers evidence of officials collecting over ₹1.07 crore as bribes and kickbacks from contractors

title: Cut off and displaced, flood-hit Kalaburagi waits for waters to recede
content: The deluge stems from massive discharge, over 3.5 lakh cusecs, from Maharashtra’s Sina, Ujjani and Veer reservoirs

title: Franklin takes 'ownership' of PSU loss to Ducks
content: Coach James Franklin, quarterback Drew Allar and the rest of the No. 3 Penn State Nittany Lions lost yet another game to a top-10 opponent, as the No. 6 Oregon Ducks posted a thrilling 30-24 victory in double overtime at Beaver Stadium.

title: Hovland out of Ryder Cup, invoking envelope rule
content: Viktor Hovland was forced to withdraw from the Ryder Cup with a neck injury. The situation forced the invocation of the "envelope rule" that means Hovland and Team USA's Harris English each earn a half-point.

title: Bethpage MC steps down over vulgar Rory chants
content: A master of ceremonies has stepped down from her role at the Ryder Cup after joining the Bethpage Black crowd in directing expletive-laced chants toward Rory McIlroy.

title: Bama upsets UGA, showing 'fight' after early loss
content: Alabama held on to beat No. 5 Georgia 24-21, handing the Bulldogs their first home loss in six years.

title: Indiana QB sorry for 'cooked' spreads after safety
content: Indiana quarterback Fernando Mendoza quipped about messing up betting lines with his wild, clock-killing scramble to end the Hoosiers' 20-15 win over Iowa.

title: Bryson, Rose, caddies get heated at Bethpage
content: The caddies for Bryson DeChambeau and Scottie Scheffler were involved in a confrontation with Europe's Justin Rose and Tommy Fleetwood during their four-ball match.

title: Kiffin's 'little, short' QB leads Rebels past LSU
content: Ole Miss quarterback Trinidad Chambliss, who didn't receive any Division I scholarships coming out of high school, helped the Rebels orchestrate a thrilling 24-19 victory over No. 4 LSU, keeping Lane Kiffin's team unbeaten at 5-0.

title: Wanderlei Silva breaks nose in postfight brawl
content: Wanderlei Silva, one of the most popular figures of early mixed martial arts, suffered a fractured nose and needed stitches after he was knocked out in the aftermath of an exhibition boxing match in Sao Paulo.

title: Ryder Cup 2025 best moments: Can Team USA make a comeback?
content: Team USA will have to pull off a legendary comeback on Sunday to win the Ryder Cup. Follow along with the best highlights.

title: Is Alabama back? Is Oregon the Big Ten's best? A raucous Week 5 reshuffled expectations
content: With four top-10 teams losing, Week 5 offered a reminder of just how little we know so early in a season.

title: Week 4 inactives: Who's in and who's out?
content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

title: Previewing Mercury-Lynx Game 4: An injured star, a suspended coach and officiating in the spotlight
content: Napheesa Collier got hurt. Cheryl Reeve got ejected. Phoenix took a 2-1 lead. What does it mean for the semifinals?

title: Our experts' final say on NFL Week 4: Key trends, fantasy sleepers and bold predictions
content: Big days for two Bears receivers? Sack opportunities for the Texans' pass rush? Upside for Geno Smith? Catch up on Week 4 prep.

title: NFL Week 4 betting guide: Picks, props and why the Bears can keep it close
content: Our experts dive into the betting tips, lines and player props that offer the best value for NFL Week 4.

title: UFC Perth takeaways: Ulberg's time is now, Crute redemption arc continues
content: What's next for Carlos Ulberg after his statement KO win over Dominick Reyes? Here are the biggest takeaways.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: What scouts are saying about Drew Allar
content: What is Drew Allar's current draft stock? Which Ohio State prospect stood out the most Saturday? We have updates on NFL prospects through CFB Week 5.

title: Atletico Madrid's big win over work-in-progress Real should kick-start their season
content: All it takes sometimes is one game to transform a season. For Atletico Madrid, Saturday's huge 5-2 win over rivals Real should do that for Diego Simeone's side.

title: Liverpool had better learn from dramatic late defeat at unbeaten Crystal Palace
content: After weeks of winning late, on Saturday Liverpool tasted defeat at Crystal Palace with the final kick of the game. The result won't wreck the Reds, but it will give them something to think about.

title: 🏈 How Campbell's 'kneecap speech' changed the NFL
content: Campbell was mocked for his introductory presser with the Lions. But players, execs and fans loved it -- and knew they had their guy.

title: ✍ Regular-season grades for all 30 MLB teams
content: Whether your team is headed to October or packing its bags for the offseason, how did 2025 measure up to expectations?

title: 🏀 Pearl steps down after 11 seasons at Auburn
content: Bruce Pearl has stepped down as the men's hoops coach at Auburn and will move into an ambassador's role in the athletic department as special assistant to the athletics director, the school announced Monday.

title: 🏈 Oklahoma St. fires longtime coach Mike Gundy
content: Oklahoma State, which has lost 11 of 12 games since the start of the 2024 season, has fired head coach Mike Gundy, who was in his 21st season with the Cowboys.

title: ↔️ Barnwell's fresh takes on 23 recent NFL trades
content: In March 2022, Seattle traded away Russell Wilson, altering the franchise's path. Let's reevaluate that move, plus 22 others from 2022-23.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool to rival Man United for Branthwaite
content: Liverpool and Manchester United are both weighing up a move for Everton center back Jarrad Branthwaite. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Liverpool pay tribute to Matt Beard on return to WSL action
content: Liverpool fans celebrated the life of former boss Matt Beard during their WSL loss to Manchester United on Sunday.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Mercury take 2-1 lead over Lynx, Aces up 2-1 over Fever
content: In the 2025 WNBA semifinals, Phoenix leads 1-seed Minnesota 2-1 while Las Vegas is up 2-1 over Indiana.

title: Category league mock draft: Jokic or Wemby at No. 1?
content: Our 10-team, H2H category league mock draft included familiar faces a the top and Amen Thompson, Cade Cunningham and Tyrese Maxey all going in the top 25.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Rookie Watch: Demidov and 11 other names you need to know this season
content: Whether in a redraft or dynasty league, here are the rookies you need to know before your fantasy hockey draft.

title: Karur stampede: A daily-wage worker mourns his baby killed in the tragedy
content: Vishnu, the youngest among the victims, was the only child of Vimal and Matheswari, who is speech- and hearing-impaired. After two years of marriage, the couple had their son. On Sunday (September 28, 2025) morning, they performed his last rites

title: Malarikkal plans to draw more visitors with added attractions, extended timings
content: The Meenachil–Meenanthara–Kodoor river relinking initiative, which hosts the annual water lily festival, is planning to install solar-powered lights at the site. This will allow visitors to admire the pink floral carpet right from midnight, when the flowers begin to bloom.

title: Efforts to allot land under extreme poverty eradication programme in final stage
content: In its final phase, EPEP focuses on providing housing for the needy, including landless beneficiaries

title: Hearings on disqualification petitions against BRS MLAs from Monday
content: Restrictions imposed on the legislature premises as four MLAs gear up to present their stand  in the first phase

title: Kanaka Durga temple in Vijayawada spruced up for ‘Moola Nakshatram’ fete on September 29
content: The presiding deity is adorned and worshipped as ‘Sri Saraswati Devi’ on the auspicious day during the ongoing Navaratri celebrations; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu to offer ‘silk vastrams’ to the Goddess on the occasion

title: Watch: Implications of Congress Working Committee meeting in Patna on Mahagathbandhan | Talking Politics
content: In this episode of Talking Politics, we will discuss the implications of CWC meeting held in Patna after 80 years on Mahagathbandhan allies.

title: Body of missing journalist recovered from lake in Uttarkashi
content: Senior journalist Rajiv Pratap’s body found in Uttarkashi lake, sparking grief and calls for investigation by officials

title: Nearly one lakh devotees throng Kanaka Durga temple for Maha Chandi darshan on Day 7 of Dasara
content: Ministers, senior officials, and MP join rituals as temple authorities enhance facilities, deploy technology, and prepare to accommodate up to 2 lakh pilgrims on September 29, coinciding with Mula Nakshatra, the goddess’s birth star

title: Government issues operational guidelines for tourism sector
content: The department says that these guidelines act like a rulebook that clarifies who can apply, what steps to follow, and how the government will process and release the benefits.

title: Karur stampede: ADGP denies stone pelting at Vijay’s rally, says sufficient police deployed for event
content: ADGP Devasirvatham said a detailed investigation will be carried out and also said around 500 police personnel led by the Superintendent of Police were deployed for bandobust for the event

title: Idols vandalised at community Durga puja in Tripura’s Gomati district
content: Police rule out conspiracy angle; security personnel deployed to maintain calm in Udaipur subdivision

title: TDB Vigilance recovers gold-plated tablets from sponsor’s relative’s house
content: A controversy had erupted in the run-up to the TDB-sponsored Global Ayyappa Sangamam, after the sponsor came on live television and alleged that his offering to the temple had gone missing since 2019

title: Ashok says there is no compulsion to provide personal information under Social and Educational Survey in Karnataka
content: Continuing his reservation against the ongoing Social and Educational Survey of the State government, Leader of the Opposition in the Assembly R. Ashok has maintained that there is no compulsion for people to provide personal information in the survey

title: Health Minister inaugurates DZBI.com in Anantapur
content: The online platform will bring together AYUSH doctors, hospitals, clinics, pharmacies, labs, and wellness seekers on a single digital interface, says Satya Kumar Yadav

title: Two teachers, one officer suspended for abstaining from survey duty in Davangere
content: These three were not only absent without valid reason but also failed to provide a satisfactory explanation

title: Dreams of two youngsters crushed in Karur rally stampede
content: M. Akash, 26, was an IT professional, and S. Gokulasri, 26, an M.Ed. graduate, was working as a guest lecturer at a college in Karur. They were trapped in the crowd and trampled to death

title: Bihar sitting on a time bomb of corruption, unemployment: Tejashwi Yadav
content: The RJD leader asks Chief Minister Nitish Kumar from where he will get additional funds to fulfil the promises made by his government ahead of Assembly polls

title: CPI(M) demands refund of ₹2,758 crore FPA charges to power consumers in Andhra Pradesh
content: Welcoming the ERC’s directive to refund ₹923 crore for the year 2024–25, the party says this alone is not enough, as consumers have already been burdened with an unjustified collection through monthly surcharge of 40 paise per unit under FPAC

title: History buffs embark on trip to iconic British-era stone rail arch bridge in Palakkad
content: The 165-year-old stone arch bridge across the Kalpathy river is among the oldest railway bridges in the country, holding significant historical value

title: Bareilly violence: Security remains heightened, neighbouring districts on high alert
content: Special police teams are working to arrest the remaining “rioters” involved in the clashes, said the officials

title: Samiti warns State govt. of intensifying agitation for pending crop insurance
content: Though the State government in March 2025 approved ₹667.73 crore of insurance claims to farmers, it has only released ₹340.99 crore of it

title: Despite respite from rain, Krishna and Bhima flowing with high quantum of water
content: It is because of heavy amount of outflow from Basavasagar Reservoir in Narayanpur and Gursunagi Bridge-cum-Barrage on the outskirts of Yadgir

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu wishes Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan a speedy recovery
content: Naidu calls on Pawan, who has been down with high fever for the last few days, at his residence in Hyderabad and enquires about his health

title: Flood warnings issued as Krishna and Godavari rivers surge in Andhra Pradesh
content: Godavari at Dowleswaram and Bhadrachalam and Krishna at Prakasam Barrage rise to warning levels. APSDMA advises residents in low-lying areas to stay vigilant, avoid crossing flooded streams and roads, and follow official instructions

title: Sri Sathya Sai police launch initiative to tackle crimes against women, minors
content: SP instructs police personnel at all sub-divisions in the district to keep close watch on rowdy-sheeters and those booked for harassment, assault and sexual crimes

title: Karur stampede: Vijay’s Namakkal-Karur campaign was originally scheduled in December
content: He was originally supposed to campaign in north Chennai and Tiruvallur on September 27. However, the plan was revised a few days ago, advancing his Namakkal and Karur visit

title: Asia Cup: Bumrah gives Rauf a taste of his jet celebration - watch
content: Jasprit Bumrah’s pinpoint yorker flattened Haris Rauf’s stumps in the Asia Cup 2025 final, followed by a viral jet celebration that electrified Dubai. This playful yet clinical act underscored India's commanding performance, restricting Pakistan to 144/9. Bumrah's memorable moment, combining a fiery delivery with a cheeky mimicry, perfectly encapsulated India's dominance and confidence in their decisive victory.

title: US church attack: Several people shot at in Michigan; shooter neutralised
content: Several people were shot at a Mormon church in Grand Blanc, Michigan, on Sunday, where the building was also ablaze. Authorities confirmed they neutralized the shooter, assuring the public there is no continuing danger. The incident took place at the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

title: Asia Cup: In one word! Bumrah sums up IND vs PAK for third time
content: Jasprit Bumrah described facing Pakistan for a third time in the Asia Cup 2025 as "interesting," emphasizing the need to start fresh despite India's undefeated streak. He highlighted his new Powerplay bowling role, reminiscent of his early career, and noted how the IPL has boosted young players' confidence. India enters the final with confidence from previous wins.

title: H-1B visa policy change: Canada PM responds to Trump's order
content: The US H-1B visa fee increase to $100,000 has created a significant opportunity for Canada to attract highly skilled professionals. Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and industry experts are urging the government to seize this moment, positioning Canada as a natural destination for talent displaced by the US policy. However, Canada's own immigration system may present challenges.

title: IND vs PAK: Why is Hardik Pandya not playing Asia Cup final? Former India coach reveals
content: India suffered a major setback ahead of the Asia Cup 2025 final against Pakistan as all-rounder Hardik Pandya was ruled out with a quadricep injury. His absence, confirmed by Ravi Shastri and skipper Suryakumar Yadav, leaves a significant void in both batting and bowling, impacting India's team balance for the crucial title clash.

title: Shaheen Afridi, Haris Rauf 'disrespect' India's national anthem at Asia Cup Final
content: The Asia Cup 2025 final between India and Pakistan was overshadowed by pre-match controversies. Pakistan pacers Shaheen Afridi and Haris Rauf faced criticism for chatting during India's national anthem, while India's Suryakumar Yadav maintained his 'No Handshake' policy with Pakistan. Hardik Pandya's absence due to injury further intensified the emotionally charged atmosphere for the finale.

title: Accenture CEO on US’ H-1B visa policy: $100K fees non issue; India workforce key
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet downplayed the new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, stating it poses minimal threat due to the company's low reliance on the program. Sweet views the policy change as a business opportunity, anticipating increased client demand for compliance navigation. This perspective follows Accenture's strong fourth-quarter financial results.

title: I love Muhammad row: 15 detained in Bareilly for inciting violence
content: Bareilly Police detained 15 individuals for stone-pelting and violence during 'I Love Muhammad' protests on Friday, sending them to jail after recovering weapons. Authorities are identifying more rioters using surveillance and intelligence. These protests, triggered by a poster controversy, saw a lathi charge and have spread across multiple districts in Uttar Pradesh and beyond.

title: Asia Cup: Pak skipper questioned ahead of India final; asked about team morale
content: The Asia Cup 2025 final between India and Pakistan commenced with an unusual toss in Dubai, featuring dual broadcasters. Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha won the toss and opted to bat, expressing confidence despite recent struggles. India's Suryakumar Yadav chose to bowl first, making three changes, as the arch-rivals met for their third high-voltage clash.

title: Tariff war: Trump aide Lutnick says India and Brazil need to be 'fixed'
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick controversially stated the US needs to "fix" India, Brazil, and Switzerland for trade deals, imposing high tariffs for their "incorrect" responses. His "mafioso-like" language drew sharp criticism, with commentators likening him to a "mafia consigliere." India, however, has responded coolly, asserting its national interest in trade negotiations.

title: H-1B visa fees hike: Startup CEO challenges move; claims it will favour tech firms
content: Box CEO Aaron Levie has strongly criticised President Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, warning it grants large tech companies an unfair advantage over cash-strapped startups in the global talent acquisition race. Levie argued the steep cost transforms international hiring into a 'spending game' smaller firms cannot win, potentially pushing innovation overseas. He advocated for a significantly lower $20,000 fee and a broader reform framework with flexible visa caps, aiming to attract top global talent while safeguarding American wages.

title: 'Rahul Gandhi will be shot': Congress writes to Amit Shah over BJP spokesperson's remark
content: The Congress party urged Home Minister Amit Shah to act against a death threat issued to Rahul Gandhi by a Kerala BJP spokesperson. Calling the threat "cold, calculated and chilling," the party highlighted previous threats and the assassinations of his family members, demanding swift legal action to ensure his safety and protect democracy.

title: Asia Cup: Huge blow to India! Hardik Pandya ruled out of final vs Pakistan
content: Team India suffers a major setback for the Asia Cup 2025 final against arch-rivals Pakistan, with star all-rounder Hardik Pandya ruled out due to a niggle. His absence, confirmed by skipper Suryakumar Yadav, significantly impacts the team's balance in batting depth and seam-bowling options, increasing pressure on others in the high-voltage clash.

title: Karur stampede: Scattered shoes, torn flags - aftermath shows how celebration ended in tragedy
content: A stampede at TVK chief Vijay's mega rally tragically claimed 40 and injured many. The chaotic aftermath left the venue in disarray, stunning locals. While Vijay expressed sorrow, the Chief Minister visited victims, as questions emerged regarding overcrowding and venue suitability.

title: Ed Sheeran’s remarks on Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce spark fan questions
content: Ed Sheeran's confession that he learned of Taylor Swift's engagement to Travis Kelce via Instagram has fueled speculation about a crack in their friendship. Fans are questioning their bond, recalling past instances of perceived disloyalty. Neither has responded, while Swift is reportedly focused on planning her wedding for next summer.

title: Nepal protests: Committee imposes travel restrictions on ex-PM Oli; barred from leaving country
content: Nepal's interim government has recommended travel restrictions for former Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli and several ex-officials. An investigation into the 'Gen Z' protests, which caused 72 deaths and led to Oli's government fall, suggested a foreign travel ban and Kathmandu Valley exit restrictions for him. The Gen Z group also demands Oli's arrest over 19 fatalities during the demonstrations.

title: Molestation case: 'Godman' Chaityananda Saraswati sent to 5-day police custody; probe on
content: A Delhi court sent Partha Sarthy alias Chaityananda Saraswati to five-day police custody for allegedly molesting female students and forgery. The former institute chairman exploited EWS students by confiscating phones and certificates, and diverted funds through a fraudulent trust. His anticipatory bail was rejected, and more victims are now coming forward.

title: Asia Cup Final: No handshake again! SKY royally ignores former Pakistan captain at toss
content: India's 'No Handshake policy' against Pakistan continued in the Asia Cup 2025 final, as Suryakumar Yadav skipped the customary handshake with Salman Ali Agha. This, coupled with an unusual toss arrangement and Pakistan's ongoing media management issues, highlighted the deep-seated rivalry and scrutiny surrounding their cricket, extending beyond the field.

title: Asia Cup: SKY snubs final photoshoot; Pak captain poses alone
content: India's captain Suryakumar Yadav skipped the Asia Cup 2025 final trophy photoshoot, leaving Pakistan skipper Salman Ali Agha to pose alone. Agha downplayed the incident, emphasizing his team's focus on cricket, adapting strategy to conditions, and reducing mistakes. Despite losing both previous encounters to India, Pakistan aims for victory in the highly anticipated final clash.

title: Trump’s H-1B move: End of the road Indians' American dream? How it may actually help
content: US President Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee hike is causing significant worry among Indian tech professionals and students in America. While aimed at protecting US jobs, experts suggest this could stifle American innovation and instead boost India's tech sector as skilled talent returns. Many Indian H-1B holders are now considering Canada, the UK, and Germany as alternative destinations.

title: Ind vs Pak: New twist! Two different broadcasters at the toss for both captains
content: The India-Pakistan Asia Cup final introduces a unique two-broadcaster toss, yet Pakistan's controversial media management dominates headlines. Their team has repeatedly avoided Indian journalists, skipping press conferences and restricting questions. This communication approach, amidst on-field struggles, has drawn sharp criticism, contrasting with India's open engagement. The PCB's vague response further fuels the controversy.

title: 'India has self-respect': Russia on Delhi's response over US oil pressure; 'no threat' to ties
content: Russia firmly defended India’s continued oil purchases despite US pressure, praising New Delhi’s “self-respect” and strong partnership. Foreign Minister Lavrov stated India’s energy choices are its own business, unaffected by US influence, and reiterated that India chooses its partners. He affirmed the robust, long-standing strategic ties between the two nations.

title: Face-off at Kerala governor's event: Vijayan slams over journal; Tharoor suggests renaming office
content: Kerala's Raj Bhavan journal launch became a political flashpoint. CM Pinarayi Vijayan criticised an article in 'Rajhamsa' for not reflecting government views, while Shashi Tharoor suggested renaming 'Raj Bhavan' to 'Lok Bhavan'. Governor Arlekar defended the journal's open platform and welcomed the renaming idea, acknowledging past controversies surrounding his office.

title: TV actor Veer Sharma and his brother pass away in a tragic fire accident
content: Ten-year-old TV actor Veer Sharma and his 15-year-old brother Shaurya Sharma tragically died from suffocation in a late Saturday night fire at their Kota apartment. The blaze, reportedly caused by a short circuit on the fourth floor, claimed their lives despite neighbours' rescue efforts. They were declared dead on arrival.

title: New Visa Rules for Umrah: Saudi makes hotel and transport pre-booking mandatory for visa
content: Saudi authorities now require confirmed hotel bookings and verified transport for Umrah visa applications, a new rule aimed at better managing pilgrim movement and preventing fraud. Pilgrims must secure these bookings, preferably through the official Nusuk platform or licensed agents, before submitting their visa application.

title: Missing lawyers & witnesses: Why are 5.3cr cases pending in Indian courts? Key reasons
content: The Supreme Court recently underscored speedy trial as an unimpeachable right amidst 5.34 crore pending cases nationwide. Key reasons for delays include unavailable counsels, absconding accused, and missing witnesses. The SC directed High Courts to ensure trials are not adjourned for counsel absence and proceed day-to-day, criticizing trial courts for flouting this mandate.

title: Asia Cup final: No place for key all-rounder in India playing XI vs Pakistan?
content: Former Indian wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel revealed his preferred playing XI for India's Asia Cup 2025 final against Pakistan, advocating for six bowling options. He notably dropped Shivam Dube for Arshdeep Singh, emphasizing bowling strength. Patel's lineup features batting depth and includes key players like Shubman Gill, whom he tipped as a potential match-winner. Hardik Pandya's injury could alter plans.

title: Asia Cup final: Ex-cricketer’s simple advice; tells India to 'win the powerplay'
content: Former cricketer Aakash Chopra advises India to dominate the powerplay against arch-rivals Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025 final. He emphasises that an early advantage will secure the match, noting Pakistan's inability to recover from a poor start and their batting struggles. Chopra also warned about Shaheen Afridi's ineffectiveness without new ball wickets.

title: India-born cheetah at Kuno becomes adult on Monday- why it matters
content: India's cheetah reintroduction program will achieve a historic milestone as Mukhi, an India-born cub, reaches adulthood at Kuno National Park on Monday. Her survival, despite siblings' deaths, underscores the project's success, with Kuno's cub survival rate exceeding 61%. Officials plan to expand the gene pool, proving cheetahs can thrive and reproduce in Indian conditions.

title: Who is Jack Bech’s girlfriend? Meet Kylie Young, Raiders rookie’s supporter
content: Kylie Young, girlfriend of Raiders rookie Jack Bech, has emerged as a prominent influencer, skillfully balancing her personal brand with unwavering support for his NFL journey. Transitioning from Alabama to Las Vegas, she showcases a stylish and grounded presence, sharing glimpses of their affectionate relationship and her lifestyle content. Young champions Bech both on and off the field.

title: OpenAI CEO warns AI could replace 40% of jobs: Is yours on the list?
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman warns that AI could soon replace 30–40% of tasks across the economy, reshaping jobs from customer support to programming. Speaking in Berlin, he predicted superintelligent AI by 2030, urging workers to focus on adaptability, lifelong learning, and creativity. Altman stressed both risks and opportunities, framing AI as a transformative but manageable force for society.

title: Asia Cup: India player slammed after flop show; called out for 'filmy gimmicks'
content: Harshit Rana struggled in his return to the Indian team against Sri Lanka, conceding 54 runs and drawing criticism from former selector Srikkanth for his "filmy gimmicks." Srikkanth lauded the magical spin bowling of Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy. Bowling coach Morne Morkel acknowledged the rustiness of Rana and Arshdeep Singh, attributing it to a lack of game time.

title: Ind vs Pak final: Raut's 'nationalism' question; claims public unwilling to watch match
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Sanjay Raut questioned nationalism ahead of the India-Pakistan Asia Cup 2025 final, arguing the match should not proceed due to recent terror attacks. He stated playing cricket with Pakistan contradicts India's stance on terrorism, claiming public sentiment opposes it and money drives the decision. Raut also criticized the BJP for allowing the series.

title: 'Stop the killing': Rahul says 'Ladakh under attack by RSS'; backs 6th Schedule
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized the BJP-led central government following violent protests in Ladakh that resulted in four deaths and the arrest of climate activist Sonam Wangchuk. Wangchuk was detained after demanding statehood and Sixth Schedule protection, with the MHA attributing the violence to his "provocative" speeches. Gandhi urged an end to the violence and demanded statehood for Ladakh.

title: Avika Gor-Milind Chandwani’s mehendi: Actress gets her in-laws’ names written on her hand
content: Avika Gor and Milind Chandwani, currently seen on 'Pati Patni Aur Panga', are celebrating their wedding festivities. During her mehendi ceremony, Avika made a heartwarming gesture by inscribing not only Milind's name but also her in-laws' and family members' names on her palms, leaving everyone stunned.

title: Gaza crisis: 66,000 killed, thousands wounded; what health ministry's new report says
content: Gaza's health ministry reports a staggering 66,000 killed and over 68,000 wounded in the Israel-Hamas war, with women and children comprising half the fatalities. The conflict, triggered by Hamas's October 7 attack, has devastated Gaza, creating a severe humanitarian crisis. Israel continues its offensive, while a US-backed plan proposes making Gaza a "terror-free zone" by removing Hamas.

title: Kohli's latest post crosses 10m likes in less than 24 hrs: why is it so special?
content: Virat Kohli's Instagram post with Anushka Sharma created a stir. The photograph showed a moment. It received over five million likes in two hours. It did not cross the ten million mark within 24 hours. The couple remains a duo. They were seen in London with their son Akaay. Their posts draw attention.

title: Taylor Swift leaves Selena’s wedding early to join Travis Kelce before game
content: Taylor Swift attended Selena Gomez's wedding in California. She then flew to Kansas City. Swift supported her fiancé Travis Kelce. He had a game against the Baltimore Ravens. This trip showed her commitment to both friends and romance. She left the wedding late Saturday night. Her private jet landed in Missouri with hours to spare.

title: Asia Cup: India vs Pak pitch for final revealed - here's how it fared in the past
content: The stage is set for a blockbuster Asia Cup 2025 final between unbeaten India and Pakistan in Dubai, on the very pitch where India decisively won their previous encounter. With India's top order in formidable form, the question looms whether history will repeat on the batting-friendly surface.

title: Stampede At Actor-Politician Vijay's Rally Described In Haunting Visuals
content: A father, holding his son's lifeless body in his arms, frantically pleading with hospital authorities to save him; a mother lying next to her dead son in a hospital bed are among the several haunting visuals that have emerged from the stampede

title: Middle East Crisis Breakthrough? Trump Says 'Something Special' Will Be Done
content: US President Donald Trump on Sunday hinted at a breakthrough in the Middle East crisis, saying "all are on board for something special," on the eve of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's visit to the White House.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Cut The Politics, We Need Answers On Tamil Nadu Tragedy
content: Velusamypuram will remain a painful memory for Tamil Nadu. The scale of the tragedy that unfolded with the loss of 40 lives, including 10 children and several women, in a political gathering is gruesome, if not unprecedented.

title: Kerala Boy, 12, Crushed By Coconut Tree While Trying To Catch Parrot: Cops
content: A 12-year-old boy died on Sunday after a coconut tree fell on him while he was attempting to catch a parrot near his home here, police said.

title: From IIT To IAS: Who is Rajeev Verma, Delhi's New Top Bureaucrat?
content: Senior IAS officer Rajeev Verma has been appointed as new Chief Secretary of Delhi. A 1992-batch officer of the Arunachal Pradesh-Goa-Mizoram-Union Territory cadre, Rajeev Verma will take charge on October 1, succeeding Dharmendra

title: Positive, Negative And In between: What World Leaders Said About Trump's Policies
content: Regardless of political perspective, no one could argue that the presidency of Donald Trump - and his second term so far in particular - has been anything less than consequential, not only for the United States but for the world.

title: Delhi BJP Gets A New 5-Storey Office. PM Modi To Inaugurate It Monday
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate the Delhi Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) new headquarters on Deendayal Upadhyay Marg on Monday.

title: Over 300 Delhi Schools, Several Airports Receive Hoax Bomb Threats
content: More than 300 schools and institutes in Delhi and several airports received bomb threats on Sunday morning, which were later declared a hoax, officials said.

title: "Lay Down Your Arms": Amit Shah Rejects Ceasefire Offer From Maoists
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday rejected the ceasefire offer given by Maoists, saying if the extremists want to surrender and lay down arms, they are most welcome to do so and security forces would not fire a single bullet on them.

title: Snapback Sanctions Trigger Confrontation Between Iran And The West
content: Iran's theocracy prepared Sunday for a possible confrontation with the West after the United Nations reimposed sanctions over its nuclear programme, even as some pushed for continued negotiations to ease the economic pain squeezing the country.

title: 12 Indian Fishermen Arrested In Sri Lanka Over "Illegal Fishing"
content: At least 12 Indian fishermen were arrested and their boat seized on Sunday near Jaffna in northern Sri Lanka, the Navy said here.

title: Woman Kills Son, 2, By Throwing Him In Pond, Hangs Self From Tree In Madhya Pradesh: Cops
content: A 26-year-old woman in Tikamgarh district allegedly killed her two-year-old son by throwing him into a pond and then hanged herself from a tree on Sunday, police said.

title: Telangana Speaker To Hear Disqualification Petitions Against 10 MLAs Tomorrow
content: The Speaker of Telangana Legislative Assembly will begin a crucial hearing on Monday regarding disqualification petitions against 10 elected legislators accused of defecting from the opposition Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) to ruling Congress party

title: Toddler "Sold" For Rs 45,000 Rescued From UP, 5 Detained: Police
content: Four men and a juvenile were detained after an 18-month-old boy in Delhi's Karol Bagh was kidnapped and "sold" for Rs 45,000, police said on Sunday.

title: Man Arrested For Leaking Ex-Girlfriend's Private Photos After Breakup: Cops
content: A 23-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly circulating private photographs of his estranged girlfriend on social media platforms following a breakup, the Goa Police said on Sunday.

title: Man Beaten To Death In Telangana Over Instagram Post: Cops
content: A 28-year-old man was allegedly beaten to death in Jagtial district after posting a message on Instagram about a woman from his village, police said.

title: '1 Cop For 50 People': Tamil Nadu Police Defends Deployment At TVK Chief Vijay's Rally
content: Tamil Nadu police have rejected allegations of inadequate deployment of personnel at Thamizhaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) chief and actor Vijay's rally in Karur, where a stampede left 40 people dead and nearly 100 injured on Saturday evening.

title: What Is 'Clog The Toilet' Racist Campaign Against Indian H-1B Holders?
content: After Donald Trump announced a $100,000 fee for H-1B visas, panic spread among Indian tech workers, who scrambled to return to the US.

title: "We Didn't Run Away": DMK's Kanimozhi Jabs TVK Chief Vijay Over Stampede
content: A day after 40 people were killed and nearly 100 injured in a stampede at Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) chief Vijay's rally in Tamil Nadu's Karur district, DMK MP Kanimozhi took a jab at the popular actor-turned-politician.

title: Trainer Aircraft Skids Off Runway At Airport In Gujarat, Pilot Unhurt
content: A single-seater trainer aircraft skidded off the runway during landing at the Amreli airport in Gujarat on Sunday afternoon, though the trainee pilot was unhurt, officials said.

title: Packers-Cowboys rivalry rewind: From the Ice Bowl to Micah Parsons' Dallas return
content: the history between the Green Bay Packers and Dallas Cowboys runs deep . ex-teammate Micah Parsons won't be last Todd Archer and Dan Graziano . his biggest meetings are loaded with potential future Hall of Famers .

title: Schottenheimer's prep to face Micah Parsons; Kenny Clark's move to Dallas
content: Mike McCarthy joins "the Pat McAfee Show" to discuss whether the Cowboys can make defensive improvements before their week 4 matchup vs. the Packers . the cowboys acquired Kenny Clark, the no-nonsense defensive tackle, and two first-round picks from the Packers for Parsons .

title: Best plays of NFL Week 4: Gainwell has a pair of TDs for Steelers in Dublin
content: Sunday's Week 4 action is underway in Dublin, Ireland, where the  Minnesota Vikings  are facing the  Pittsburgh Steelers  this morning in the first international NFL game of 2025. 14 teams will be in action during the early set of afternoon games, headlined by the 3-0  Tampa Bay Buccaneers  hosting the 3-0  Philadelphia Eagles . We'll also see No. 1 pick QB  Cam Ward  and the 0-3  Tennessee Titans  at the 0-3  Houston Texans , as those teams look to get their first win. Rookie QB  Jaxson Dart  is set to make his first start for the 0-3  New York Giants  against the undefeated  Los Angeles Chargers . The late afternoon set of four games features the  Baltimore Ravens  heading west to face the  Kansas City Chiefs , as this pair of 1-2 championship contenders aim to gain some traction. And QB  Daniel Jones  and the surprising 3-0  Indianapolis Colts  are at the 2-1  Los Angeles Rams . Here are the top plays from Sunday, and be sure to keep checking back once the afternoon games kick off.
